newsitem.title: UK: LucasVarity shares seen steady after results.
newsitem.headline: LucasVarity shares seen steady after results.

text.p: Shares in newly merged LucasVarity Plc are set to open steady to firmer on Thursday, in line with the market after first quarter results came out in line with forecasts, analysts said. The shares closed Wednesday at 204p.

"It look pretty steady as she goes but it does mean numbers are beginning to come through to show that they can do what they said they are going to do," said Lehman analyst Charles Armitage. Pre-tax profit was 72 million stg against 62 million last time, based on proforma combined results following the merger between Lucas and Varity in September 1996.
The market was expecting a pre-tax figure of 70-75 million.
LucasVarity said in a trading statement with its results that it is "on track to deliver modest, top-line growth this year".
